instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message:
coffee damaged around lcd connector

cleaned, i replaced the lcd connector, no picture no backlight but laptop works fine, there is picture on ext monitor and boots

tried another lcd, same 
i removed the lcd cable from original lcd, and the cable is not damaged, so that did not damage the board only the coffee directly

i guess the board wont recognise the lcd at all, what should i measure?

j8300 pin1 is zero, sometimes 5v, sometimes zero

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message:
l8300 has 5v on it after 3 sec of connecting the charger cable, then in few seconds that goes away

does it mean it tries to recognise the lcd but cant?  its doing the same thing with another lcd

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> works, it is 3.3V, measured on <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR>, if i move a magnet close to it voltage drops to zero, magnet moved away 3.3V comes back

now i replaced the area around lcd connectot, all component looked bad,  <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>, l8300, and caps around them

same, still boots on external monitor so cpu has to be ok, ext mouse works

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message: <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> pin1 was tricky, seemed soldered, but it was not, i scratched the pcb and soldered it to the incoming trace, now display works but sometimes the backlight is vibrating

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message:
Backlight flickers more on low, or high backlight level?
Try again known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture no backlight
threads.message: it was flickering on all levels, but now i took it apart to replace the keyboard, that was water damaged too, and now its not flickering, i hope it remains like that
